ADMONITION_INFO_CONTENT: This is a string with information.

BUTTONS_COUNT_TEXT.one: You have clicked the default button once (shift-click to reset)
BUTTONS_COUNT_TEXT.other: You have clicked the default button {{count}} times (shift-click to reset)

DIALOG_BOXES_DESCRIPTION: Click on a button to open a dialog box
DIALOG_BOX_ERROR_CONTENT: The disc in the drive is not rewritable, so it cannot be erased.
DIALOG_BOX_ERROR_INFO: If you need to destroy the data on the disc, you should physically break it in half.
DIALOG_BOX_GOBLIN_CONTENT:
After battling through hordes of goblins, you finally stand before the throne of the Goblin King himself. The grotesque creature eyes you with contempt from his towering seat.

"So, you're the meddlesome adventurer who's been causing trouble in my kingdom, he growls. I'll give you one chance to save your miserable hide. Swear fealty to me, and I'll let you live as my servant. Refuse, and you'll spend the rest of your days in the darkest pit of my dungeons!"

The Goblin King leans forward, his putrid breath washing over you as he awaits your answer. The weight of your decision could shape the fate of the entire goblin realm.
DIALOG_BOX_INFORMATIONAL_CONTENT: This is the main text of the message box. It conveys the primary information or message that needs to be communicated to the user.
DIALOG_BOX_NUCLEAR_REACTOR_CONTENT:
You are attempting to perform an extremely hazardous operation that could result in catastrophic consequences if not executed with extreme caution.

This operation has the potential to cause:
- Complete data loss
- Irreversible system damage
- Breach of security protocols
- Unrecoverable corruption

Only proceed if you are an expert user and fully understand the risks involved. Improper handling could lead to disastrous and irreparable results.
DIALOG_BOX_NUCLEAR_REACTOR_INFORMATIONAL: This is the informative text displayed in grey below the main text. It provides additional context and warnings about the dangerous operation. Attempting this operation without proper expertise and precautions could lead to permanent and devastating damage to your systems and data. Proceed at your own risk.
DIRECTORIES_DESCRIPTION: On this platform, the standard directories are as follows.
FAILING_JOB_IN_PROGRESS_DESCRIPTION: This job will fail halfway through processing.
I18N_DATE_TIME_DESCRIPTION: Dates are formatted in the following manner in this locale:
I18N_NUMERIC_FORMAT_DESCRIPTION: Numbers are formatted in the following manner in this locale:
I18N_QUOTE_STRING_DESCRIPTION: Type some text below to see it quoted.
I18N_SETUP_DESCRIPTION: Enter a locale code to see information about that locale.
INDETERMINATE_JOB_IN_PROGRESS_DESCRIPTIO: This job has an indeterminate progress bar.
INTERSTITIAL_MESSAGE: Interstitials can be used to welcome the user, or to surface an error.
JOBS_DESCRIPTION: Jobs represent long running processes that are currently running in the background. When a job is added, it shows in the Jobs pane in the top right corner of the window.
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_DESCRIPTION: For jobs that have the potential to finish quickly, delayed tracking ensures the job isn't registered in the job manager if it is finished quickly.
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_QUICK: Start Quick Job with Delayed Tracking
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_QUICK_FAIL: Start Failing Job with Delayed Tracking
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_QUICK_FAIL_IN_PROGR: This job shows up in the job menu before the specified delay because it fails before then.
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_QUICK_IN_PROGRESS_D: This job won't show up in the job menu because it finishes too quickly.
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_SLOW: Start Slow Job with Delayed Tracking
JOB_DELAYED_TRACKING_SLOW_IN_PROGRESS_DE: This job will show up in the job menu because it takes some time to finish.
JOB_MENU_DESCRIPTION: If you need to, (for example, if a job requires attention soon after it is started) you can programmatically open the job menu.
POPOVERS_DESCRIPTION: Click on a button to open a popover
SETTINGS_DESCRIPTION: The Settings surface would ordinarily display now.
STANDARD_JOB_IN_PROGRESS_DESCRIPTION: A description of the current task can go here.
TRANSIENT_JOB_IN_PROGRESS_DESCRIPTION: This job is transient and so will disappear automatically once it is complete.
